Posts.Content: Sep 7, 2007 05:03PM BePositive wrote: Janet, I didn't tweek my treatment but if I'm not mistaken, you can still have reconstruction with expanders and implants even after your chest wall has been radiated. That is the option that I am to do although I have not met with the plastic surgeon yet. I had a mastectomy and the clear margin was very small, not to mention 4 positive lymph nodes and lymphovascular invasion. Radiation to the chest wall (i.e. where the breat used to be) will kill any cancer cells that may have been left behind. BePositive
Posts.Title: Has anyone tweeked their treatment? jsims2 nevaeh
